did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the Carr and Terrell Families
1735-1894

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the Carr and Terrell Families, Accession #4757--4757-f, 5670, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given as a gift on March 19, 1957, January 1961 and May 17, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Materials predominantly relate to the Carr and Terrell families of Virginia and Kentucky. Includes the family correspondence of Thomas Jefferson's sister, Martha Jefferson Carr of Albemarle County, Virginia, and related Davis, Minor, and Terrell families; will (1735/38) of Thomas Carr of "Topping Castle," Caroline County, Virginia; and genealogical notes of the Carr,Davis, Minor, Overton, and Waters families.

Also included are nine inscriptions from tombstones at Christ Church, Middlesex Co., Virginia; Peter Carr's Notes on law; and rolls (ca. 1839) for University of Virginia classes in anatomy and surgery, chemistry, law, modern languages, and moral philosophy.
